14:26 <vmassol> sburjan: fyi see the mail I sent on the list for running tests in a loop to debug flickering tests  
14:26 <+sburjan> vmassol: ok. just to finish something urgent  
14:26 <vmassol> sburjan: you should mark regressions as blocker in jira  
14:26 <vmassol> for ex http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6812  
14:27 <+sburjan> ok  
14:27 <vmassol> and you can set the fixfor to the dev version in progress  
14:27 <vmassol> since all regressions have the highest priority of all  
14:27 <+sburjan> is there any field from which I set regression ? of I just say it's a regression in the content  
14:28 <vmassol> you can tag with regression if you want  
14:28 <+sburjan> ok  
14:29 <+sburjan> done

14:37 <+lucaa> can anyone point me to a place to find more information about this form\_token parameter that gets sent with the forms?  
14:37 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <vmassol> @lucaa: all I know is that it's for CSRF  
14:39 <vmassol> s/CSRF/CSRF protection/  
14:39 <+lucaa> yes, I know that. I'm trying to figure it out  
14:40 <+lucaa> what is it supposed to do for anti-CSRF?  
14:40 <+lucaa> to make sure that the form is a valid form generated by the xwiki server?  
14:40 <vmassol> the form adds the id and the received action checks for a valid form\_token param AFAIK  
14:40 <vmassol> yes something like that but I don't know exactly  
14:40 <+lucaa> right  
14:40 <+lucaa> ok  
14:40 <+lucaa> that's causing 6812  
14:40 <+lucaa> XWIKI-6812  
14:41 <+lucaa> I'll try to fix it now  
14:41 <+lucaa> hope it will work fast  
14:41 <vmassol> ok …btw CSRF has been enabled for several weeks now  
14:41 <vmassol> so this means we have no tests for the dashboard  
14:41 <+lucaa> yes  
14:41 <vmassol> since we ddidn't see it until sorin ran a manual test for it  
14:42 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:42 <+sburjan> btw, did we finish the release of 3.2 M1 ? like finish all the procedure .. because I don't see the announcing e-mail  
14:42 <sdumitriu> has quit

14:43 <+sburjan> yes it is  
14:43 <+sburjan> but I was used with the announcing e-mail :)  
14:43 <vmassol> can you ping sergiu ?  
14:44 <vmassol> (about it)  
14:44 <vmassol> he may have forgotten it  
14:44 <vmassol> but indeed it seems to indicate the release is not 100% over

15:26 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no  
15:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: was it you?  
15:26 <+tmortagne> the choice between java 5 and 6 is a symlink on the server  
15:26 <+tmortagne> it has nothing to do with jenkins  
15:26 <vmassol> indeed then it must be sdumitriu....  
15:27 <vmassol> we really need not to do it that way  
15:34 <+sburjan> vmassol: did you started working on annotationsTest re-factoring ? if not, I can start and have something by the end of the week  
15:34 <vmassol> no I didn't start

15:35 <vmassol> please  go ahead ASAP since it's fialing the build right now  
15:35 <+sburjan> ok, I'll start then  
15:35 <vmassol> cool  
15:35 <vmassol> I can review it if you have it before friday noon  
15:35 <vmassol> (I won't be avail during the week end)

15:44 <maggo> hi all, i have a question on the available downloads on xwiki.org. I can't find a download package xwiki-manager-mysql-3.1.zip without the included jetty. On forge.ow2.org i can find to XEM downloads, first xem-3.0.1, second xm-3.1. Which is the newest version? Or includes xem-3.0.1 the newest version of the manager application? Can someone enlight me :)  
15:45 <vmassol> 3.1 > 3.0.1  
15:46 <vmassol> however  
15:46 <vmassol> it's true that it's possible that some bugs that were fixed after 3.1 was released could have been incorporated in 3.0.1 and in 3.2-SNAPSHOT  
15:46 <vmassol> (thus not in 3.1)  
15:46 <vmassol> since 3.0.1 was released after 3.1  
15:46 <vmassol> hope this helps ;)  
15:47 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
15:48 <sdumitriu> has quit  
15:49 <sburjan> has quit  
15:50 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <lucaa> has quit  
15:55 <maggo> Hi vmassol, so the right package is xwiki-manager-mysql-3.0.1.zip for my XEM Update?  
15:55 <vmassol> how would I know that? :)  
15:55 <sdumitriu> has quit  
15:55 <vmassol> if you want 3.1 it's not the right package  
15:55 <vmassol> if you want only a bug fix release of 3.0 then it's correct  
15:57 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <maggo> i want the newest xem version but it's not clear how to update it to 3.1 if that is the newst one, oh i should mention that i don't use Jetty i use a tomcat application server. so I don't know if i can use the jetty package for my tomcat. Thats so confusing for me because i documented the way how to update and i followed this documentation since the last 10 updates and now the package that i downloaded the last times is not the same now  
16:02 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:02 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <+tmortagne> maggo: XEM package with mysql and not jetty never existed, it's either XEM war without the mysql connector or the ready to use jetty/mysql package and always been like that  
16:07 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:07 <+tmortagne> the only thing that changed in the name of the jetty/mysql package  
16:07 <+tmortagne> it used to not contain jetty in the name  
16:08 <+tmortagne> because there is only jetty packages distributed for XEM but it has been changed to be aligned on XE  
16:09 <+tmortagne> for upgrade you should  use the war package and takes the mysql connector from your previous install  
16:09 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <+tmortagne> did you look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HUpgradinganXWikiInstallation (which is indicating to use the war package to upgrade) ?  
16:14 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:15 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <cjdelisle> has quit  
16:17 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:18 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <vmassol> guys (tmortagne), any idea why the invitation test is failing on agent-3? http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.invitation/InvitationTest/testSendMailToTwoAddresses/  
16:20 <vmassol> it seems there's a mail issue but AFAIK we're using greenmail in the test  
16:20 <+tmortagne> not sure about this test but we are using greenmail for sure in others  
16:20 <vmassol> I checked and we're using greenmail  
16:22 <vmassol> it's as if greenmail wasn't started  
16:22 <vmassol> but I don't see any error in the console about starting greenmail  
16:22 <+tmortagne> any other test failing because of greenmail ?  
16:22 <+tmortagne> are watchlist test working for example ?  
16:23 <vmassol> well there's this error: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.watchlist/WatchThisPageAndWholeSpaceTest/testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace/  
16:23 <vmassol> (but only one watchlist test is failing)  
16:23 <+tmortagne> it seems  
16:23 <+tmortagne> yep only one is sending mails  
16:23 <vmassol> and the error there is different:  
16:23 <vmassol> Caused by: org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [org.xwiki.rendering.renderer.PrintRendererFactory] hint = [default]]  
16:23 <+tmortagne> hmm does not looks like mail related issue  
16:24 <+tmortagne> "Can't find descriptor" seems pretty serious issue in the build  
16:24 <maggo> tmortagne: yes i know that way but i'll use it the way i documented so its not the newest version but my stable way i know. Thank you all  
16:24 <vmassol> I've seen this test failing on other agents too  
16:24 <vmassol> so let's focus on greenmail for now  
16:24 <vmassol> something in the environment of agent-3 seems different than on agent-1 or 2  
16:25 <vmassol> maybe port 3025 is used  
16:25 <vmassol> checking  
16:25 <+tmortagne> yep was think about that  
16:25 <+tmortagne> but isn't greenmail supposed to take a free port ?  
16:25 <+tmortagne> I mean automatically  
16:25 <vmassol> that would't work  
16:25 <+tmortagne> (it should)  
16:25 <vmassol> ah yes  
16:25 <vmassol> that's why  
16:25 <vmassol> it is  
16:25 <vmassol> but  
16:25 <vmassol> we send to 3025  
16:25 <vmassol> which is not respondng  
16:26 <vmassol> that would make sense  
16:26 <+tmortagne> then we should set the configuration to whatever greenmail is using  
16:26 <+tmortagne> dynamically  
16:27 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:31 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <lucaa1> guys, apparently since the enabling of CSRF you cannot send changes to actions (save) with ajax anymore, unless you also have a form\_token. At least this is the case of the problem with dashboards  
16:36 <lucaa1> can anyone think of other untested places where this happens?  
16:36 <lucaa1> e.g. submitting a tag  
16:36 <lucaa1> or something  
16:39 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:41 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
16:41 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:45 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:47 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:52 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:53 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <sdumitriu> has quit  
17:16 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:49 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
17:49 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
17:51 <+tmortagne> vmassol: actually as far as I can see in GreenMail code the port is fixed  
17:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you check if port 3025 is used on the machine?  
17:51 <+tmortagne> btw looks like we are not using GreenMail the best way: we are enabling everything (SMTP, SMTPS, POP3, POP3S, IMAP, and IMAPS)  
17:51 <+tmortagne> no yet  
17:55 <+tmortagne> I don't see anything listening on port 3025  
17:56 <+tmortagne> on agent-3  
17:56 <vmassol> hmm then I don't understand...  
17:56 <+tmortagne> restarting the test  
17:58 <+tmortagne> vmassol: btw the configuration of the test job you created are not right, you forgot to tie them to "tests" tag  
17:59 <vmassol> I removed it  
17:59 <vmassol> why would I need it?  
17:59 <+tmortagne> you should have created them by copying xwiki-enterprise-tests  
17:59 <vmassol> I want the jobs to run on all agents  
17:59 <+tmortagne> because we don't want to run test on all agents  
17:59 <+tmortagne> at least we did not before  
17:59 <vmassol> that's not true anymore  
17:59 <vmassol> we used to want that  
18:00 <vmassol> but not anymore with the additional agents we're adding  
18:00 <vmassol> we'll have 4 agents on the new machine  
18:00 <vmassol> (we have 1 now, alex has added another one, and 2 more will be added after)  
18:01 <vmassol> that said we could dedicate one agent to not have tests if we want that's true  
18:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have to go in a few minutes, we can discuss that later if you want  
18:03 <+tmortagne> vmassol: if we have the 6 agents soon it's ok I think  
18:03 <+tmortagne> we can always get back to the previous one server dedicated to build later  
18:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm not sure if we'll be allowed to keep the old agents too, we need to ask  
18:03 <vmassol> that said, the new machine can probably support more than 4 agents  
18:04 <vmassol> it's a fast one,  
18:04 <vmassol> we can check the cacti graphs for it  
18:04 <+tmortagne> if we don't have more than 4 agents i would be to keep one server dedicated to simple build  
18:05 <+tmortagne> restarted test-ui on agent3, lets see if it was a one time thing  
18:08 <+tmortagne> maybe a test forget to stop greenmail  
18:08 <+tmortagne> checking other tests  
18:11 <sburjan> has quit  
18:11 <maggo> has left #xwiki  
18:13 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is lots of nasty exceptions in http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1/consoleFull  
18:14 <+tmortagne> greenmail is only one issue among lots of others it seems  
18:16 <+tmortagne> hmm can't be a forgotten greenmail issue since sending mail would work in this case

21:29 <vmassol> ok guys we really need to understand why deleting an attachment fails from time to time on master  
21:29 <vmassol> http://tinycoke.com/\_6ryccqv2KbrpA/xwiki\_preferences\_(xwiki.xwikipreferences)\_-\_xwiki\_1312399728880.png  
21:29 <vmassol> any idea on how to debug this?

23:19 <jvelociter> has quit  
23:26 <Webgraphics> has joined #xwiki  
23:32 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
23:33 <Webgraphics> hey does anyone know if the 3.0 release use restlet 2.0?  
23:33 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
23:34 <@sdumitriu> 2.0 isn't used yet  
23:34 <@sdumitriu> There was a blocker bug when trying to upgrade to it  
23:35 <Webgraphics> ahhh okay . is it scheduled to be in a version yet?  
23:35 <@sdumitriu> It's planned ASAP  
23:36 <@sdumitriu> But we have to find a workaround for that bug first  
23:37 <Webgraphics> awesome thanks. I think there was a problem with restlet and the SSO, so I wanted to try it with restlet 2.0
